author: paulhauner
content: I‚Äôm seeing timeouts from Geth on newPayload and fcU whilst it is syncing. I‚Äôm running mainnet 1.10.21-stable. The timeouts are stopping the CL from syncing optimistically, since optimistic import requires SYNCING or ACCEPTED. cc <@360491619402776577> üôè

author: mandrigin
content:
I have a question about LH
I have an EL Nethermind node, that synced until the merge (couple of weeks ago)

and I can't seem to make LH work with it
I seems to be hitting this code
https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/blob/df51a73272489fe154bd10995c96199062b6c3f7/beacon_node/eth1/src/service.rs#L253

I don't think that rule is correct for the EL, because the EL can't sync past the merge point, and in that case LH doesn't send and fcU's and I see this error in the console all the time.

maybe I am doing something dumb though

author: mandrigin
content: but I think if the merge had happened couple of weeks ago, it is normal to EL to not be able to return "fresh" blocks, because it has no idea which chain to follow, and this code seems to be blocking it from guiding further

author: mandrigin
content:
so I think that I can formulate the possible bug as "if the merge on a network was > 4 hours ago, you can't sync Erigon/Nethermind + LH from scratch on that network"
but again, I might have misunderstood something in the configuration

author: lukaszrozmej
content: Which consensus clients use eth_syncing and what assumptions they make about them? In particular does lighthouse use it in any way? Will it send FCU if eth_syncing is true?

author: tersec
content: Nimbus uses `eth_syncing` primarily as a safe, efficient, engine-API-compatible test request to sanity-check the endpoint it's provided

author: lukaszrozmej
content: does it use it in any logic about further engine api requests?

author: tersec
content: No, it doesn't, currently

author: ajsutton
content: Teku uses syncing to determine if the node is ready to be used to retrieve deposits. It doesn‚Äôt affect the engine api calls at all though so you still get all the same newPayload and fCU you would otherwise.

author: paulhauner
content:
As discussed in another channel, LH does not make any assumptions about ethSyncing when it comes to the engine API. This was a recent change (~2 weeks).

However the ‚Äúeth1 service‚Äù will make assumptions about ethSyncing but that is all about the deposit contract and nothing about importing beacon blocks or payloads. We‚Äôve been using this assumption for 1.5yrs and it seems to be fine. The logs do seem to distract EL devs though üòÖ I‚Äôm not sure how to clarify them in a way doesn‚Äôt distract EL devs but still gets the users attention.

author: terence0083
content: On top of my head, I don't think prysm uses `eth_syncing`. I'll double-check. There's also this table here: https://hackmd.io/E9VKRcmRSc2Imo8RBtqxlw?view Not sure if it's up to date
